## inferConstraints() function

> This API is provided as an alpha preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.
> 

Infer dimensional constraints from a pattern without full compilation.

This is a lighter-weight alternative to `compilePattern` that returns a partial dimensional rule with only the constraints that can be directly inferred from the pattern. Useful for analysis or validation.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function inferConstraints(pattern: PatternRule): Partial<DimensionalRule>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

pattern


</td><td>

[PatternRule](./change-detector-core.patternrule.md)


</td><td>

The pattern rule to analyze


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

Partial&lt;[DimensionalRule](./change-detector-core.dimensionalrule.md)<!-- -->&gt;

Partial dimensional rule with inferred constraints

## Example


```typescript
const constraints = inferConstraints({
  type: 'pattern',
  template: '{target} type narrowed',
  variables: [{ name: 'target', value: 'parameter', type: 'target' }],
  returns: 'major'
})

console.log(constraints.aspect)  // ['type']
console.log(constraints.target)  // ['parameter']
console.log(constraints.impact)  // ['narrowing']
```
